name: Top-Level Model Registration
description: Register a complete Earth system model for CMIP7
title: [EMD] Model Registration:

field_guidance.name:
**Model name becomes CMIP7 source_id**

**Format:**
- Include family name (recommended): 'HadGEM3-GC31-HH', 'CESM2'
- Include version: 'CNRM-ESM2-1', 'UKESM1-0-LL'
- Use hyphens for separators
- Use consistent capitalization

**This name will be used:**
- As @id in EMD
- As source_id in CMIP7 file metadata
- In directory structures
- In data citations

**Choose carefully** - changing later requires re-registration!
field_guidance.family:
**Model family:**

Models in a family share substantial code but differ in:
- Resolution (e.g., -LL, -MM, -HH suffixes)
- Component selection
- Parameter tuning
- Configuration

**Examples:**
- Family: 'HadGEM3' → Models: 'HadGEM3-GC31-LL', 'HadGEM3-GC31-MM', 'HadGEM3-GC31-HH'
- Family: 'CESM' → Models: 'CESM2', 'CESM2-WACCM', 'CESM2-FV2'
- Family: 'CNRM-CM' → Models: 'CNRM-CM6-1', 'CNRM-ESM2-1'

**Must be registered first** via Model Family issue.

**Leave as 'Not applicable' if:**
- First model (no family yet)
- Standalone model
field_guidance.description:
**Must cover ALL three component categories:**

**1. Dynamic components** (brief overview):
'Includes atmosphere (ARPEGE-Climat v6.3) with 91 levels extending to 80km, ocean (NEMO v3.6) with ORCA1 grid, and land surface (SURFEX v8) with multi-layer soil and vegetation.'

**2. Prescribed components** (explain treatment):
'Atmospheric ozone is prescribed from monthly mean climatology. Sea surface temperatures are prescribed for AMIP experiments.'

**3. Omitted components** (note absence):
'Land ice is omitted - no interactive ice sheets.'

**Guidelines:**
- Be concise - detailed descriptions are in component registrations
- Mention all component types from the CV
- Explain why prescribed/omitted
- 2-4 paragraphs typical
field_guidance.dynamic_components:
**Components that are actively simulated in the model.**

**Each dynamic component you select here:**
- Must have a registered Model Component
- Must have a component_config ID to list below
- Will appear in your model's output

**Common configurations:**
- **Minimal**: atmosphere, ocean, land-surface (3)
- **Standard**: + sea-ice, land-ice (5)
- **Earth System**: + atmospheric-chemistry, aerosol, ocean-biogeochemistry (8)

**Select all that are dynamically simulated** in your model.
field_guidance.prescribed_components:
**Components represented by input data** (not simulated).

**Examples:**
- Prescribed SSTs for atmosphere-only runs
- Prescribed ozone for models without chemistry
- Prescribed sea ice for ocean-only models

**These components:**
- Are NOT registered as Model Components
- Use input data (constant or time-varying)
- Don't require component_config IDs

**Leave empty if all components are either dynamic or omitted.**
field_guidance.omitted_components:
**Components completely absent from the model.**

**Examples:**
- No atmospheric chemistry (simplified models)
- No land ice (no ice sheets)
- No ocean biogeochemistry (physical ocean only)

**These components:**
- Are NOT registered
- Have no representation in model
- Should be mentioned in description as omitted

**Leave empty if all components are either dynamic or prescribed.**
field_guidance.component_configs:
**Enter component_config IDs, one per line:**

**Format:** {domain}_{component_id}_{h_grid}_{v_grid}

**Example:**
```
atmosphere_arpege-climat-version-6-3_c100_v100
land-surface_surfex-v8-modeling-platform_c100_v102
ocean_nemo-v3-6_c101_v103
aerosol_tactic_c100_v100
atmospheric-chemistry_reprobus-c-v2-0_c100_v100
sea-ice_gelato_c101_v104
ocean-biogeochemistry_piscesv2-gas_c101_v103
```

**You received these IDs** when you submitted Model Component issues.

**Requirements:**
- Must list exactly one config per dynamic component
- All configs must already exist
- Order doesn't matter

**Validation:** System will check configs exist and match your dynamic_components list.
field_guidance.embedded_components:
**Define which components run inside others.**

**Format:** One pair per line as `embedded,host`

**Example:**
```
aerosol,atmosphere
atmospheric-chemistry,atmosphere
sea-ice,ocean
ocean-biogeochemistry,ocean
```

**Rules:**
- Use component TYPES (not component IDs)
- Embedded component must be in dynamic_components
- Host component must be in dynamic_components
- Embedded components CANNOT be in coupling_groups
- Can have nested embedding (A in B, B in C)
- NO cycles (A in B, B in C, C in A = invalid)

**Common patterns:**
- Aerosol/chemistry embedded in atmosphere
- Sea ice/biogeochemistry embedded in ocean

**Leave empty if:** No embedded components (all are coupled)
field_guidance.coupling_groups:
**Define groups of mutually coupled components.**

**Format:** One group per line, components comma-separated

**Example 1 - Fully coupled (3-way):**
```
atmosphere,land-surface,ocean
```
All 3 exchange data directly.

**Example 2 - Multiple groups:**
```
atmosphere,ocean
land-surface,land-ice
```
Two separate coupling groups.

**Example 3 - 4-way coupling:**
```
atmosphere,land-surface,ocean,land-ice
```
All 4 coupled together.

**Rules:**
- Use component TYPES (not IDs)
- Only SUPERIOR HOST components (NOT embedded ones)
- Components in a group ALL couple with each other
- All coupled components must be connected (directly or indirectly)

**Superior hosts** = components NOT listed as 'embedded' in embedded_components.

**Validation:** System checks no embedded components in coupling groups!
field_guidance.calendar:
**Calendar types define which dates are valid in your model.**

**Most common:**
- **standard** (gregorian): Standard calendar with leap years (most common)
- **365_day** (noleap): Fixed 365 days, no leap years (paleo simulations)
- **360_day**: 12 months × 30 days (idealized)

**List in order of use:**
- Put most commonly used first
- Example: If 'standard' for historical/future and '365_day' for paleo, list both with 'standard' first

**For CMIP7:**
- Only include calendars you'll actually use in CMIP7 experiments
- Don't list all possible calendars your model *could* use
field_guidance.release_year:
**When was this model first used?**

Acceptable:
- Year of first publication using this model
- Year model version was released
- Year simulations began

**Examples:**
- CNRM-ESM2-1: 2018 (Séférian et al. 2019 paper)
- UKESM1-0-LL: 2019 (Sellar et al. 2019 paper)

**Not:**
- Year of institution founding
- Year of first model in family

**Must be** between 1950 and current year.
field_guidance.reference_dois:
**Model-level publications only:**

Provide DOI URLs for papers describing:
- The complete model as a whole
- Model overview and design
- Multi-component integration

**DO NOT include:**
- Component-specific papers (those go in Model Component issues)
- Papers using the model for science
- Technical reports without DOIs

**Format:**
```
https://doi.org/10.1029/2019MS001791
https://doi.org/10.1029/2019MS001683
```

**One DOI per line, no other text.**

**Typically 1-3 references** for model overview papers.
